titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Maurice Sand Papers
titlestmt.author: by Ève Bourbeau-Allard

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 03:07

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: The Maurice Sand papers contains family and professional correspondence, publishing contracts, writings, drawings, posters, and other material by or about the nineteenth-century author, illustrator, and puppeteer. The collection offers substantial documentation of Sand's theatrical work from the late 1840s to the 1880s; included are holograph scripts, scenarios, or posters for over forty puppet plays created by Sand. The collection also includes three novel drafts, a set of playing cards issued by an unidentified French publisher with humorous additions in ink and pencil by Sand, as well as a manuscript libretto, manuscript music fragments, with vocal lines only, and related correspondence for Callirhoé (circa 1886), an opera by Auguste Bazille (1828-1891) with text by Armand Silvestre (1837-1901) based on a scenario by Sand.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Box 10: Restricted fragile material. Reference surrogates have been substituted in the main files. For further information consult the appropriate curator.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Les Amazones on the Edwin J. Beinecke Book Fund, Frederick W. Hilles Fund, and Mary Flagler Cary Fund, 2011-2017.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into five series: I. Correspondence and Contracts, 1848-1929. II. Puppet Theater, 1848-1995. III. Writings, 1841-1886. IV. Artwork, 1833-1887. V. Other Papers, 1853-1960.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Maurice Sand (1823-1889), son of author George Sand (1804-1876) and Casimir Dudevant (1795-1871), was a French writer, artist, and puppeteer. Sand studied painting with Eugène Delacroix in the early 1840s, and later wrote and illustrated several novels and monographs on topics ranging from theater history to the natural sciences. Sand directed an amateur puppet theater at the Sand family estate of Nohant from 1847 to 1876, and at his Paris residences, for which he authored plays, designed sets, and sculpted and operated wood puppets.

Sand married Lina Calamatta in 1862, with whom he had a son, Marc-Antoine (1863-1864), and two daughters, Aurore (1866–1961) and Gabrielle (1868–1909). Sand served as mayor of the Nohant-Vicq commune in 1848, and from 1875 to 1879.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Maurice Sand Papers. General Collection, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels, depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived research value, the availability of staff, competing priorities, and whether or not further accruals are expected. The library attempts to provide a basic level of preservation and access for all collections, and does more extensive processing of higher priority collections as time and resources permit.

The processing of this collection involved combining together eight separate accessions of material acquired over time from the same provenance. Information included in the Description of the Papers note, as well as in file titles and descriptions, is drawn from information supplied with the collection by the seller and previous owner, and from a survey of the contents.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Materials
relatedmaterial.p: Associated material of the same provenance: the Solange Clésinger-Sand Papers (GEN MSS 755) and the Edmond Plauchut Papers (GEN MSS 1462), Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Maurice Sand papers contains family and professional correspondence, publishing contracts, writings, drawings, posters, and other material by or about the nineteenth-century author, illustrator, and puppeteer. The collection offers substantial documentation of Sand's theatrical work from the late 1840s to the 1880s; included are holograph scripts, scenarios, or posters for over forty puppet plays created by Sand. The collection also includes three novel drafts, a set of playing cards issued by an unidentified French publisher with humorous additions in ink and pencil by Sand, as well as a manuscript libretto, manuscript music fragments, with vocal lines only, and related correspondence for Callirhoé (circa 1886), an opera by Auguste Bazille (1828-1891) with text by Armand Silvestre (1837-1901) based on a scenario by Sand.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Maurice Sand Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into two subseries: Personal Correspondence, and Publishing Contracts and Correspondence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I. Correspondence and Contracts, comprises both personal letters and professional communications with publishers. Correspondence with Auguste Bazille and Armand Silvestre regarding the opera Callirhoé is located in Series III. Writings. Twentieth-century third-party correspondence by Aurore Sand regarding family property is located in Series V. Other Papers.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Personal correspondence contains autograph and copied letters exchanged between Maurice Sand and family members, acquaintances, and politicians. Letters concern the health of family members, awards and mayorial duties bestowed on Sand, and comments on Sand's writings.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: File titles specify if letters are outgoing (sent by Sand to the correspondent), or incoming (received by Sand from the correspondent).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy in the hand of Lina Sand of an 1885 letter from Maurice to his sister.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copy in the hand of Lina Sand of an undated letter (circa 1868) from Flaubert commenting on Sand's novel Miss Mary .

did.unittitle: Matheson, A. for the Société de l'Agriculture de Châteauroux (from)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by a letter from Noémi Renan to Aurore Sand (1929).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter sent on behalf of the puppet characters of the Théâtre de Nohant, and two letters regarding Maurice's son's illness.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Copies in the hand of Aurore Sand of letters exchanged between George and Maurice Sand, and of a letter in Italian by Frederic Chopin to George Sand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Publishing contracts and correspondence document Maurice Sand's business relations with publishers for a significant number of his literary works, as well as the involvement of George and Lina Sand in negotiating terms of publication. Key figures of nineteenth-century French publishing are represented, including Michel and Kalmus Lévy (firms Michel Lévy frères until 1875 and Calmann-Lévy thereafter), and Albert Lacroix (firm A.Lacroix, Verboeckhoven).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contract with Michel Lévy frères (1872), bills from Typographie Chamerot et Renouard (1900-1901), and correspondence between Lina Sand and Georges Rochegrosse (1896-1899) regarding the edition illustrated by Rochegrosse.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from Maurice Sand to Emile [Aucante] regarding a mistake in the printing of "Callirhoé" in Revue des Deux Mondes , July 1863 issue.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Albert Lacroix and Maurice Sand, and between Lacroix and George Sand. George Sand's response is a copy in the hand of Lina Sand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contract with Paul Ollendorff.

scopecontent.p: Contract between Maurice Sand and Ernest Bouju (1860), letter from A. Laplace regarding a lawsuit for counterfeited products based on Sand's illustrations (1869).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Contract with Ernest Bouju for Deux jours dans le monde des papillons (1860), contract with J. Rothschild for Le monde des papillons (1866).

scopecontent.p: Letter from Michael Lévy frères confirming acceptance of contract.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three subseries: Scripts and Scenarios, Posters, and Related Material.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Puppet Theater, includes scripts, scenarios, manuscript posters, drawings, and print material documenting the work of Maurice Sand in directing an amateur puppet theater at the Sand family estate of Nohant and at his Paris residences. All writings and posters are holograph unless specified otherwise in the file description.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Accompanied by "Le tombeau des secrets", a Christmas gift list for family members and friends.

did.unittitle: "La goule de Tornemar", copy by Armand Silvestre
"La chambre bleue: Comédie de famille, mêlée de chiens et de bruits en un acte", copy by Lina Sand with holograph additions
"Balandard aux enfers", character lists and tirade script
"Une soirée à Paris", copy by Lina Sand with holograph additions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Empty envelopes for chronological groupings of theater scenarios and scripts with labels in contemporary hand. Envelopes had been separated from the material prior to their arrival at the Beinecke Library, and some of the years indicated on the envelopes are not represented among the scripts and scenarios of this collection.

Clipping "La soirée théâtrale: Les marionnettes de Maurice Sand", from Le Figaro

Studies of costumes [for the play "Claudie"], pencil

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series III. Writings, contains manuscripts of narrative and non-fiction writings by Maurice Sand, including holograph drafts with corrections for three novels ( Le coq aux cheveux d'or , La fille du singe , and Palabran ), a script for the opera Callirhoé (accompanied by a partial music score and related correspondence with composer Auguste Bazille and lyricist Armand Silvestre), and notes on various topics of interest to Sand.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Titles devised during processing are in brackets.

scopecontent.p: Copy in the hand of Aurore Sand, and photocopy of the text in another hand.

scopecontent.p: Notebook containing holograph texts and notes on a variety of topics, some of which relate to published works such as Le coq aux cheveux d'or , Miss Mary , and Callirhoé .

did.unittitle: "Notes sur l'artillerie fournies par A. Bazille", holograph

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes tracings for a work on lepidoptera.

did.unittitle: Palabran , novel, holograph draft and notes
Le Pied-sanglant , play script, manuscript with holograph annotations
"Quelques mots sur la lune...(tirés des notes d'un voyageur)", holograph

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series IV. Artwork, contains small drawings, sketches, and watercolors on various themes, as well as French playing cards featuring humorous variations drawn by Maurice Sand. A sketchbook dating from Sand's childhood highlights his early interest for drawing. The series does not contain artwork identified as relating to Sand's illustrated publications. Additional artwork pertaining to puppetry is located in Series II. Puppet Theater.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Titles were transcribed from captions or devised at the time of processing.

scopecontent.p: Thirty playing cards featuring humorous figures drawn by Maurice Sand around the standard French suits, particularly the hearts and the tiles.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Sketchbook from Maurice Sand's childhood featuring ink drawings of soldiers, an illustrated "Almanach de France, 1833", multiplication tables and other learning exercises.

did.unittitle: "Souvenir d'un voyage autour de la table", pencil
Study of a flower, pencil and watercolor

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series V. Other Papers, comprises all other items in the collection relating to Maurice Sand, including photographic portraits, print material about Sand, files on family property, and honorary titles.

did.unittitle: Booklet Maurice Sand by George Ay
Clippings of obituaries for Maurice Sand
File on Le Christ en croix by Peter Paul Rubens

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Material documenting the provenance of the painting in the Sand family: contemporary inventory of personal property brought by Maurice Sand to his marriage, later statement of ownership by Aurore Sand, and photograph of painting.

did.unittitle: File on portrait of Marie Delaporte by Maurice Sand

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence between Aurore Sand and third parties, a photographic print of the painting, and a copy in the hand of Daniel Delaporte of the 1860 contract between Maurice Sand and actress Marie Delaporte.
